channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: How rich is Andrew, the former UK royal, arrested over Epstein links?
After years of links to Epstein, why has Andrew, UK’s former prince, been arrested now?
Epstein files and beyond: The scandalous life of Britain’s Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor
Should we be amused or afraid of China’s 'kung fu robots'?
‘Third world aliens’: How Hanuman statue in Texas is at centre of Maga hate
Prison, impeachment and more: The troubled history of South Korean presidents
Imran Khan letter: A well-meaning appeal that could complicate India’s diplomatic position
item.description: While Islamabad stays silent for strategic reasons, the letter written by 14 former cricket captains to Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Imran Khan risks being turned into a diplomatic lever against New Delhi

item.title: In an uncertain West, France emerges as India’s steadiest strategic partner
item.description: By deepening defence, technology and political ties with India, France anchors itself in one of the fastest-growing major economies and a pivotal Indo-Pacific actor.

item.title: How Trump’s escalation math doesn’t yet add up to war with Iran
item.description: Under current conditions, Washington seeks leverage without entanglement. Restraint persists not from trust, but from calculation.

item.title: Macron in India: Strengthening diverse, time-tested India-France ties
item.description: The French President's visit, though coinciding with the AI Summit, will focus on military-industrial cooperation, with France expected to further enhance India’s defence capacities and capabilities

item.title: Beyond the fighter jet: How the Rafale deal could transform India’s defence ecosystem
item.description: With this mega deal, India gets ready to transform Make in India defence and give it unprecedented depth

item.title: Quadro: An illusion or a reality in a fractured world order?
item.description: In an era of geopolitical rupture, a quadrilateral partnership comprising India, Russia, the United States and China remains suspended between possibility and illusion — its future contingent not on rhetoric but on the hard calculus of shared interest, restraint and pragmatic statecraft.
